content.prompt: Which of the following pieces of historical evidence would support the overall argument in the excerpt?

choices.label: The Democratic political machine in San Francisco failed to gain a majority of Irish votes in elections during the 1880s.
Many Irish politicians in Philadelphia became members of the Republican Party in the late 1800s.
Political factionalism among Irish voters in Boston in the 1890s discouraged the formation of a Democratic political machine.
People of Irish descent in New York City registered to vote at a higher rate than their proportion of the population in the 1890s.

skill.text: Skill 3.D: Explain how claims or evidence support, modify, or refute a source's argument.
